text: ke yābi ke yābi bhāi bhava-sindhu pāra
translation: Who will cross, O brother, who will cross the ocean of material existence? Oh! The fortune of this Age of Kali is the appearance of Śrī Chaitanya.

text: kaḍipāti nāhi lāge amani pāra haya
translation: At my Lord Gaurāṅga’s ghāṭ the upstream ferry runs without requesting any fare. Everyone crosses freely.
The Lord’s Names are the ferryboat, Śrī Guru is the captain, and the outstretched arms in the saṅkīrtan are the oars.
All souls have thus been delivered by the winds of divine love. Only Lochan Dās has fallen and remained behind, as a result of his sins.
